text.section: A person is guilty of divulging illegally obtained information when he knowingly uses or divulges information obtained through eavesdropping or tampering with private communications or learned in the course of employment with a communications common carrier engaged in transmitting the message.
Divulging illegally obtained information is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 231, effective January 1, 1975.
